Key Match Events: India's 15-game unbeaten home run came to an end at the hands of Qatar
Moustafa Mashal scored the opening goal for Qatar in the 4th minute
Almoez Ali bundled the ball into the back of the net in the 47th minute
Yousuf Abdurisag scored Qatar's third goal in the 86th minute
India failed to capitalize on big chances and trouble the reigning Asian champions
Pre-Game Insights: India were hoping for a strong start in the game but things didn't go according to plan right from the start
India's goalkeeper Amrinder was selected ahead of Gurinder Sandhu for the match
Post-Match Reflections: Igor Stimac and his men were given a reality check
India's next opponents will be Afghanistan in their third group game on March 21, 2024
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in Bhubaneswar
Qatar dominated the first quarter of the game and kept creating chances
Afif was the main troublemaker for the Indian defenders
Amrinder made a stunning save to deny a chance for Qatar in the first half
Others: India's home run came to an end at hands of Qatar (Courtesy: Indian football Twitter)
The Indian shotstopper Amrinder was called into action yet again in the 32nd minute as he denied Mashal from doubling his and Qatar's tally
